title: Smartwatch app to track social interactions of stroke survivors may help maximize recovery
desc: A smartwatch app designed to measure social interactions of hospitalized stroke survivors may enable new treatments to preserve or enhance cognition, social engagement and quality of life after a stroke, according to a preliminary study to be presented at the American Stroke Association's International Stroke Conference 2026.

title: Berlin-Bound Chinese Film 'Light Pillar' Lands at Cercamon
desc: Dubai-based sales company Cercamon has acquired worldwide rights to Xu Zao's Berlinale selection 'Light Pillar.'

title: UJE urged to safeguard co
desc: DODOMA: The Commissioner and Chief Executive of the Tanzania Cooperative Development Commission (TCDC), Dr Benson Ndiege, has directed the newly formed Ushirika Joint Enterprise (UJE) management to ensure that the interests of cooperative unions, which own a 51 per cent stake in COOP Bank Tanzania, are well safeguarded. Dr Ndiege issued the directive in Dodoma

title: Samsung's First Pair of AR Glasses Are Coming Later This Year
desc: The brand confirmed a launch window for its new smart eyewear, but it hasn't officially shared much else.

title: Contractors face termination over poor progress in Nairobi's informal settlements
desc: Lot 1 projects have reached only 27.3 per cent completion, far below the expected 98 per cent target.

title: Chelsea want to sign Jeremy Jacquet - plus the three players who could still leave
desc: Club keen on securing services of Rennes centre-back this month and will make decisions on Axel Disasi, Aarón Anselmino and Tyrique George

title: ‘Pesticide cocktails’ polluting apples across Europe, study finds
desc: Pan Europe found several pesticide residues in 85% of apples, with some showing traces of up to seven chemicals

title: Student arrested for selling fully verified mobile wallet
desc: Police have arrested a 20-year-old female student during an entrapment operation in Bantay, Ilocos Sur for the illegal online sale of a fully verified GCash...

title: Over 36,000 new homes completed in 2025 - CSO
desc: A total of 36,284 homes were built in Ireland last year, an increase of 20.4% on 2024, according to the latest data from the Central Statistics Office.

title: GoldBod to deploy inspectors against unlicensed Jewellers February 2
desc: The Ghana Gold Board (GoldBod) has announced the deployment of inspectors nationwide from Monday, February 2, 2026, to clamp down on unlicensed jewellery
